title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
OB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' feature, a message appears at the top of the wizard that says, 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists.' This message is displayed even when the package name field is empty.
EB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' feature, the message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should only appear when a package name is entered and there is an existing folder with that same name. If the package name field is empty, this message should not be displayed.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Invoke the 'New Java Package' feature.
2. Observe the message that appears at the top of the wizard, even with an empty package name field.
